This field determines whether the product is defined for inheritance purposes only and will not be available for sale.

This field acts as a pointer to a defined set of conditions for the Property.
This field defines the link between the product designer and the arrangement.
The Product Builder supports a number of options in terms of how each arrangement will be affected by changes to its Product definition.
To provide the highest level of flexibility, each set of Product Conditions on a Product are defined as fixed, tracking, or negotiable.

Fixed – Once the arrangement has been opened, all conditions for a specific Property will be set for the duration of the arrangement. Subsequent changes to the “fixed” product conditions will not affect the arrangement.

Tracking – The Product Conditions of a Property will contain values for all mandatory parameters. At the arrangement level the user cannot change any of the conditions of the Property. Throughout the duration of an arrangement any product level changes to a “tracking” property will be reflected in the arrangement.

Negotiable – This type of arrangement property behaves in a similar way to “tracking” properties except that individual conditions can be input (within negotiation limits) at the arrangement level. Any attributes, which have been input, will effectively become fixed for the duration of the arrangement. All other attributes will track changes at the product property.

This field represents the effective period after which the new property condition comes into effect.

In addition to dated changes of a single Defined Property, the Product designer also allows a Product to be defined with “timed” changes of its conditions. These timed changes may be defined as “condition changes” (i.e. a standard product property is linked to one Defined Property and after a period of time switches to a different Defined Property.
This field represent the effective base of the new property condition. It will accept two values.
1. START
2. ANNIVERSARY

START – Forward condition effective date is calculated by considering base date as value date of arrangement. In case disbursement has happens different date than new arrangement creation date then all existing START type conditions will be deleted and new conditions created based on disbursement date of the arrangement

ANNIVERSARY – Forward condition effective date is calculated by considering base date as anniversary date which is exist in account property field ANNIVERSARY. In case anniversary date has changed in life of the loan then all anniversary conditions will be deleted and new conditions created based on new anniversary date.

ARRANGEMENT – It is default value of this field. If user doesn’t select any one of above options then system will treat those are ARRANGEMENT type conditions. Forward condition effective date is calculated by considering START.DATE of the arrangement. It will not be changed any of the time.
This field represents the effective date from which the product change comes into force.
